description.en:
Sometimes he's a one-eyed ruffian, other times he's a jeweler.
But the reality is... Shonen G-Men, Ichiro Hanaoka!
A young boy receives a special mission from the Metropolitan Police Department and solves cases using his special skill, judo and shooting!

[Commentary]
A mysterious incident occurs in which an ancient Egyptian mummy comes back to life during a disassembly experiment, and the doctor in charge goes missing! Boy G-man Ichiro Hanaoka is dispatched! !

The 1950s. Following the huge success of works such as "Billy Pack'' and "Maboroshi Detective,'' new detective adventure manga were created one after another in manga magazines for boys. "Shonen G-Men'' is a boy detective manga drawn by Tsunayoshi Takeuchi, whose representative work is "Akadou Suzunosuke,'' which was published in Kobunsha's 'Shonen'' magazine from April 1960 during this time. Ichiro, a young boy who receives a special mission from the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, drives around in a car while still being a child and goes on a rampage, firing a pistol all over the place, but the highlight is Ichiro's brilliant disguise scene, which is thought to have been influenced by the "Tarao Bannai'' series. right. This unique ability to deceive both friend and foe adds depth to the story, and sets it apart from other detective manga. This book includes all of the serials in the "Shonen'' magazine as well as the full-scale thriller short story "Birdman of Hell.''
